description.plain: Matthew Wilder is an American musician, composer and record producer. In 1983, he had a Top 5 hit titled “Break My Stride”. He is also known for his film and production work, producing albums such as No Doubt’s Tragic Kingdom and contributing to the music in Disney’s 1998 film Mulan.

body.plain: Matthew Wilder is an American musician, composer and record producer. In 1983, he had a Top 5 hit titled “Break My Stride”. He is also known for his film and production work, producing albums such as No Doubt’s Tragic Kingdom and contributing to the music in Disney’s 1998 film Mulan.

songs.full_title: Break My Stride by Matthew Wilder
songs.title: Break My Stride

description.plain:
“Break My Stride” is about a girl leaving Wilder  behind as she is moving on to further adventures. However, according to a 2012 interview with Wilder, he expressed that the song was written in part because of his frustration with his label Arista Records:

Clive Davis was notorious for writing notes, and all those notes would always accompany the cassette … So I hear [head of A&R at Arista] reading Clive’s note to me, and he mentions every tune but “Break My Stride.” I said, “What about ‘Break My Stride’?” And he reads Clive’s note that says, “Interesting song, but not a hit.” When I heard that, I said, “Listen, I’ve been at this label for two years, and if you guys can’t hear this, there’s nothing I can do for you anymore. I think you should let me go.”

Wilder then found Epic subsidiary Private I Records, “run by arguably the most powerful man in radio at the time, Joe Isgro,” and decided to produce an album and “Break My Stride” with Private I. Incidentally, his vow to not “break his stride” did result in this single, which is by far his most popular song.

“Break My Stride” peaked at #5 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #4 on Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart in 1984. Most memorably, the song has been sampled by Diddy in his 1997 song “Can’t Nobody Hold Me Down.”

songs.lyrics:
36 ContributorsBreak My Stride Lyrics[Verse 1]
Last night, I had the strangest dream
I sailed away to China
In a little rowboat to find ya
And you said you had to get your laundry clean
Didn't want no one to hold you, what does that mean?
And you said

[Chorus]
Ain't nothin' gonna break my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
I'm runnin' and I won't touch ground
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
[Verse 2]
You're on a roll and now you pray it lasts
The road behind was rocky
But now you're feeling cocky
You look at me and you see your past
Is that the reason why you're runnin' so fast?
And she said

[Chorus]
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break my stride
I'm runnin' and I won't touch ground
Oh no, I got to keep on moving

[Bridge]
(Never let another girl like you)
Work me over
(Never let another girl like you)
Drag me under
(If I meet another girl like you)
I will tell her
(Never want another girl like you)
Have to say, oh
You might also like[Chorus]
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no (Oh no), I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break my stride
I'm runnin' and I won't touch ground
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no (Oh no), I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
I'm runnin' and I won't touch ground
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
(Whoa)
Ain't nothin' gonna break my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
I'm runnin' and I won't touch ground
Oh no, I got to keep on moving
Ain't nothin' gonna break-a my stride
Nobody gonna slow me down
Oh no (Oh no), I got to keep on moving18Embed

songs.lyrics:
1 ContributorI Don’t Speak the Language LyricsI was a banker
Family man
Working in Paris
When I began
Living my daydreams
I left my wife
Sailed for the islands
To start a new life

Down in the tropics, a colorful world
Green of the ocean and brown native girls
Now I'm an artist and I see nothing wrong
To paint Tahitian without her sarong, oh no
You know I don't speak the language
But I still understand
It's in the move of her body
And in the touch of her hand
You know I don't speak the language

Am I a madman
To follow the sun
When it's every man's dream
To do what I've done?

Oh, no needs, no worries and no sense of time
She's Polynesian and she is all mine
Today I'll paint her in yellows and reds
Tonight we'll make love with stars overhead, oh no

You know I don't speak the language
But I still understand
It's in the move of her body
And in the touch of her hand
You know I don't speak the language

De lay lo lay lo lay lo lay lo
De lay lo lay lo la
De lay lo lay lo lay lo lay lo la
You might also likeYou know I don't speak the language
But I still understand
It's in the move of her body
And in the touch of her hand
You know I don't speak the language

I left the tempo
Of civilized man
To dance the tango
Utopian

Mmm, how can I leave here, how can I go back?
The life here is so aphrodisiac
Her eyes, her lips and the smell of her hair
Make me a savage and I cease to care, oh no

You know I don't speak the language
But I still understand
It's in the move of her body
And in the touch of her hand
You know I don't speak the language

De lay lo lay lo lay lo lay lo
De lay lo lay lo la
De lay lo lay lo lay lo lay lo
De lay lo lay lo la
De lay lo lay lo lay lo lay lo
De lay lo lay lo la

songs.lyrics:
2 ContributorsThe Kid’s American Lyrics[Verse 1]
Rocket with the top down, whoa
Barrelin' down Highway 9
Pickin' up the same crowd, whoa
By the Pepsi sign

[Pre-Chorus 1]
Baby, gun your gas
Paint your lipstick on 'til it shines like glass
Midnight riders, lovers, rock 'n' roll
Oh yeah
Yeah, yeah
[Chorus]
Got it in the blood, the kid's American
Underneath the hood, you know the kid's American
'Cause he looks so good, the kid's American
Cruisin' faster than he should, the kid's American

[Verse 2]
Out behind the high school, whoa
Smokin' that cigarette
Deep into the blue jean, whoa
And gonna get deeper yet

[Pre-Chorus 2]
On the night cool grass
Something's in the wind and it's comin' fast
Hold on, baby, try to take it slow
Oh no
Yeah, yeah

[Chorus]
Got it in the blood, the kid's American
Underneath the hood, you know the kid's American
'Cause he looks so good, the kid's American
Cruisin' faster than he should, the kid's American
Look out now
You might also like[Bridge]
Drag it out all night
'Til there's nothing left by morning light
Drive it 'til your chassis bottoms out
Oh yeah

[Chorus]

Underneath the hood, you know the kid's American
